title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: aud his son, and mounted on horseback behind oneof the horsemen in his company. The coachmendrove on to Clarendon House, and told the porterthat the Duke had been seized by two men, whohad carried him down Pickadilly. The porter immediately ran that way, and Mr. James Clarke chancingto be at that time hi tbe court of the house, followed with all possible haste, having first alarmedthe family, and ordered the servants to come afterhim as fast as they could.
